Spanish(es):
Las llamadas Casas Reales, sede de la Real Audiencia de Quito, creada por la Corona española el año 1563, se instalaron aquí en 1612. Para mediados del siglo XVIII se derrocaron esas casas e, integrándose otras propiedades se levantó un nuevo edificio sobre un atrio con pretil, que ocupaba todo el frente de la plaza. Luego de la independencia, pasó a ser sede del gobierno republicano.

Es conocido desde los años 1970 como Palacio de Carondelet, en recuerdo de Luis Francisco Héctor Barón de Carondelet, XXIX presidente de la Real Audiencia, quien gobernó desde 1799 hasta 1807.

Durante el gobierno del doctor Camilo Ponce Enríquez, entre 1956 y 1960, se realizó una profunda reconstrucción del edificio.
Spanish (Ecuador)(es-EC):
Real Hatun Wasi shutirishkakunaka, Real Audiencia Quito llaktapa ukuka, Corona española Apukkunapa 1563 watapimi wacharirka, Kay ukupika kawsaytaka 1612 watapimi kawsayta kallarirka. Kay XVIII chawpi chunka pusak patsakwatapika chay wasikunataka urmachirka, kipamanka kay samana kuska chimpapika, shuk allpakunata tantachishpa mushuk hatun wasitami shayachirka. Kishpirishka puncha hipamantaka, republicano Kapakpukpami wasi tukurka.

1970 Waranka iskun patsak kanchis chunka watamantami Palacio de Carondelet shutiwan riksirishka kan, ashtawampacha Luis Francisco Héctor Barón de Carondelet, ishkay chunka iskun Real Audienciapa ñawpaman pushak, shinallata 1799 waranka kanchis patsak iskun chunka iskun watamanta, 1807 waranka pusak patsak kanchis watakaman mamallaktata ñawpaman pusharka, chaymantami pay taytata yuyarishpami kay Hatun wasika chay shutiwan riksirishka kan

Kay 1956 waranka iskun patsak pichka chunka sukta watamanta shinallata 1960 waranka ishuk patsak sukta chunka watakaman, Doctor Camilo Ponce Enríquez Kapakapukpa pachapika, kay wasitaka mushukyachirkakuna, chay kashkamantami kunan riksikripanchik.
French(fr):
Les anciennes Maisons Royales, siège de l'Audience Royale de Quito, créées par la Couronne espagnole en 1563, furent établies ici en 1612. Au milieu du XVIIIe siècle, ces maisons furent démolies et d'autres propriétés furent ajoutées. Un nouveau bâtiment fut érigé sur un atrium avec parapet, occupant toute la façade de la place. Après l'indépendance, il devint le siège du gouvernement républicain.

Il est connu depuis les années 1970 sous le nom de Palais de Carondelet, en mémoire de Luis Francisco Héctor Baron de Carondelet, 29e président de la Cour royale, qui gouverna de 1799 à 1807.

Sous le gouvernement du Dr Camilo Ponce Enríquez, entre 1956 et 1960, une importante reconstruction du bâtiment fut entreprise, dont une partie est encore visible aujourd'hui.
English(en):
The once-called Royal Houses, the seat of the Royal Audience of Quito, created by the Spanish Crown in 1563, were established here in 1612. By the mid-18th century, these houses were demolished, and other properties were added. A new building was erected over an atrium with a parapet, occupying the entire plaza front. After independence, it became the seat of the republican government. 

It has been known since the 1970s as the Carondelet Palace, in memory of Luis Francisco Héctor Baron of Carondelet, the 29th president of the Royal Court, who governed from 1799 to 1807.

During the administration of Dr. Camilo Ponce Enríquez, between 1956 and 1960, a major reconstruction of the building was carried out, part of which can be seen today.

Spanish(es):
La fachada neoclásica es resultado de la primera transformación republicana, realizada desde 1843 con proyecto del arquitecto francés Teodoro Lavezzari. 
En el gobierno del general José María Urbina, entre 1851 y 1856, se insertó el escudo nacional en los tímpanos de los cuerpos laterales.
Spanish (Ecuador)(es-EC):
Ñawpa mushuk rikchashkaka republicana kallariy mushukyachishkami rikurin. 
1843 waranka pusak patsak chusku chunka kimsa watapi Francia mamallaktamanta Teodoro Lavezzari wasirurayachak taytami paktachishka. 
General José María Urbina Kapakapuk pachapi, 1851 waranka pusak patsak pichka chunka shuk  watamanta 1856 waranka pusak patsak pichka chunka sukta watakaman pullkanka unanchatami churarkakuna.
French(fr):
La façade néoclassique est le résultat de la première transformation républicaine, réalisée à partir de 1843 selon un projet de l'architecte français Teodoro Lavezzari. 
Sous le gouvernement du général José María Urbina, entre 1851 et 1856, les armoiries nationales furent insérées dans les tympans des corps latéraux.
English(en):
The neoclassical façade is the result of the first republican transformation, carried out starting in 1843 with a design by the French architect Teodoro Lavezzari. 
During the administration of General José María Urbina, between 1851 and 1856, the national coat of arms was inserted into the tympanums of the lateral bodies.

Spanish(es): Algunos bloques de piedra andesita de la base son poligonales, como las piedras de los edificios incaicos, por lo que se ha especulado, sin fundamento, sobre su origen prehispánico.

French(fr): Murale « La découverte du fleuve Amazone »

Spanish(es):
A manera de tríptico, en mosaico de teselas venecianas, narra la épica historia del descubrimiento del río Amazonas. La gesta, iniciada en Quito por unos 200 españoles encabezados por Gonzalo Pizarro, con más de 3000 indios tomados a la fuerza, trasmontó la cordillera oriental de los Andes y se internó en la tupida selva. El 12 de Febrero de 1542, el capitán Francisco de Orellana, separado de la expedición, llegó al Río Mar y al no poder regresar, navegó hasta su desembocadura en el Atlántico, para dar cuenta, luego, a la Corona de su descubrimiento.

Lo llamaron río de las Amazonas, pues en algún punto de su trayecto fueron atacados supuestamente por una tribu de mujeres guerreras, que les recordó a las Amazonas de la mitología griega.
Spanish (Ecuador)(es-EC): Kay Tullpushka pirkapika Amazonas mayuta tarishkamantami rikuyta ushanchik, kay tarishkakunamanta rikushpaka, Quito llaktamanta 200 ishkay patsak españoleskuna, 3000 kimsa waranka runakunawan Gonzalo Pizarro ñawpashpa kallarishkakuna, ashtawampacha urkukunata yallishpa, sachakunaman yaykurkakuna. El 12 chunka ishkay punlla de panchi killa 1542 waranka pichka patsak chusku chunka ishkay watapi Francisco de Orellana capitán taytami Río Mar mayuman chayarka, shinapash mana chaymanta tikrayta ushaymanta Atlántico hatun kuchaman wampurka, chay kipami kay hatun tarishkamantaka Corona Apukkunaman willachirka. Amazonas shutitaka, purikuypi wakin tantanakushka warmi makanakukrunakuna makankapak shayarishka ninkuna, chaymantami mitología griega Amazonas nishkamantami yuyarishkakuna.
French(fr):
Sous forme de triptyque, en mosaïque de carreaux vénitiens, il raconte l'épopée de la découverte du fleuve Amazone. L'entreprise, lancée à Quito par quelque 200 Espagnols menés par Gonzalo Pizarro, et plus de 3 000 indigènes capturés de force, traversa la cordillère orientale des Andes et pénétra dans la jungle dense. Le 12 février 1542, le capitaine Francisco de Orellana, séparé de l'expédition, atteignit le Río Mar et, ne pouvant revenir, navigua jusqu'à son embouchure dans l'Atlantique, rapportant plus tard sa découverte à la Couronne.

Ils l'appelèrent le fleuve Amazone car, à un moment donné de son cours, ils auraient été attaqués par une tribu de femmes guerrières qui leur rappelaient les Amazones de la mythologie grecque.
English(en): In the form of a triptych, in a mosaic of Venetian tiles, it tells the epic story of the discovery of the Amazon River. The undertaking, begun in Quito by some 200 Spaniards led by Gonzalo Pizarro, with more than 3,000 indigenous people taken by force, crossed the eastern Andes mountain range and entered the dense jungle. On February 12, 1542, Captain Francisco de Orellana, separated from the expedition, reached the Río Mar and, unable to return, sailed to its mouth in the Atlantic, later reporting his discovery to the Crown. They called it the Amazon River because, at some point along its course, they were supposedly attacked by a tribe of warrior women who reminded them of the Amazons of Greek mythology.

Spanish(es): Creada por el francés Emmanuele Fontaine, inaugurada el 25 de mayo de 1909 en la ciudad de Sucre, Bolivia. Bronce, 37 cm. En la madrugada del 1° de septiembre de 1975, una facción del Ejército intentó tomar por asalto el Palacio de Gobierno con el fin de derrocar al dictador general Guillermo Rodríguez Lara, fracasando en su intento. La escultura resultó impactada por un proyectil.

Kaytaka 25 ishkay chunka pichawa punllapi, aymuray killapi 1909 waranka iskun patsak iskun watapimi kallariy rurayta paktachishkakuna, Sucre llaktapi, Bolivia Mamallaktapi. Llaksa, 37 cm. Kimsa chunka kanchis cm. 
Kallariy Kuski killapi 1975 waranka iskun patsak kachis chunka pichka watapi, tutamanta pachapimi Awka tantanakushka runakunami Kapakapukpa wasita llakichinkapak yaykushka, ashtawampacha dictador Guillermo Rodríguez Lara taytata urmachinkapak, shinapash mana kay llakichitaka paktachishkakuna. Kay llakikunapimi kay Llakllakamashkataka waktashkakuna
French(fr):
Réalisée par l'artiste français Emmanuele Fontaine, inaugurée le 25 mai 1909 dans la ville de Sucre, en Bolivie. Bronze, 37 cm.

Le 1er septembre 1975, aux premières heures du matin, une faction de l'armée tenta de prendre d'assaut le palais du gouvernement pour renverser le dictateur général Guillermo Rodríguez Lara, mais échoua. La sculpture fut touchée par un projectile.
English(en): Created by the French Artist Emmanuele Fontaine, inaugurated on May 25, 1909, in the city of Sucre, Bolivia. Made of bronze, 37 cm. In the early hours of September 1, 1975, an army faction attempted to storm the Government Palace in an attempt to overthrow dictator General Guillermo Rodríguez Lara, but failed. The sculpture was hit by a projectile.

Enlightened doctor, lawyer, and writer from Quito, he was a precursor to the independence movement. His writings, the publication of "Firsts drafts of the Culture of Quito," the first newspaper of the Royal Audience (Court) in 1792, and the creation of the "Patriotic Society of Friends of the Country of Quito," led to the development of a Quito national consciousness.
Persecuted and imprisoned for sedition, he died in Quito after a rigorous prison sentence in December 1795.

Women's participation was decisive in the emancipation process. They acted in a variety of ways, sacrificing their peace of mind, their good name, their possessions (abundant or limited), and even offering their very lives. Mrs. Manuela Cañizares hosted one of the city's most active gatherings in the rooms she occupied across from the Public University. Various intellectuals and patriots met there, and from there, in the early morning of August 10, 1809, they moved to depose the Spanish authorities.

Considerado líder indiscutible, estadista y héroe nacional, es un ícono cultural en toda Latinoamérica. Su legado es diverso y de gran alcance dentro y fuera de los países que libertó.

Fue su presidente hasta 1830, cuando desilusionado por las divisiones internas y su pérdida de liderazgo, ante el surgimiento de caudillos locales, renunció al encargo. Considéré comme un leader incontesté, un homme d’État et un héros national, il est une icône culturelle dans toute l’Amérique latine. Son héritage est diversifié et d’une grande portée, tant à l’intérieur qu’à l’extérieur des pays qu’il a libérés.

Venezuelan soldier and politician who liberated the present-day Republics of Venezuela, Colombia, Panama, Ecuador, Peru, and Bolivia from Spanish domination. Considered an undisputed leader, statesman, and national hero, he is a cultural icon throughout Latin America. His legacy is diverse and far-reaching both within and outside the countries he liberated.

In 1819, he founded the Republic of Colombia, comprised of the first four countries mentioned above. He served as its president until 1830, when, disillusioned by internal divisions and his loss of leadership due to the rise of local leaders, he resigned. He died prematurely on December 17, 1830, while heading into exile.

Waranka iskun patsak sukta chunka watapi Kapakapuk wasimanka cubierto, vajilla de cristal y porcelana nishkakunatami kushka, shinallata matelería pintukunatapash kushkakuna, ashtawampacha Purhardt (Inglaterra), Christofle y Baccarat (Francia) y Ascençao (Portugal) mamallaktakunamanta apamushkakuna.
Cubertería, Copas de Cristal de Baccarat y piezas de vajilla nishkakunapash upyankapapash apamushkakuna waranka pusak patsak sukta chunka watapi.
French(fr):
En 1960, le Palais et la Résidence Présidentielle ont été dotés de couverts, de vaisselle en cristal et en porcelaine, ainsi que de linge de table en quantité suffisante, achetés auprès de Purhardt (Angleterre), Christofle et Baccarat (France) et Ascençao (Portugal).

Les couverts, les verres en cristal de Baccarat et la vaisselle arborent les armoiries officielles de l'Équateur, utilisées depuis 1860.
English(en):
In 1960, the Presidential Palace and Residence were provided with sufficient cutlery, crystal and porcelain tableware, and table linens purchased from Purhardt (England), Christofle and Baccarat (France), and Ascençao (Portugal).
Cutlery, Baccarat crystal glasses, and tableware bear the official Coat of Arms of Ecuador, used since 1860.

English(en): A small altarpiece was added, made of carved and gilded wood, with polychrome Quito sculptures of the Immaculate Conception, Saint Joachim, and Saint Anne, from the 18th century, belonging to the National Museum.

Spanish(es): El cuerpo central, levantado en el gobierno del doctor Gabriel García Moreno, aloja un reloj y sus campanas, instalados en la presidencia del doctor Jerónimo Carrión entre 1865 y 1867. En el vértice ondea el pabellón nacional, de lunes a viernes de 7h00 a 17h00, y sábados, domingos y feriados de 8h00 a 17h00.
Spanish (Ecuador)(es-EC):
Doctor Gabriel García Moreno Kapakapuk pachapimi chawpi Wasi shayakuktaka shayachishkakuna, pachachik shinallata campanas kayachik nishkakunatapash Doctor Jerónimo Carrión 1865 waranka pusak patsak sukta chunka pichka watamanta shinallata 1867 waranka pusak patsak sukta chunka kanchis watakaman churarkakuna.
Punta hawa wasipika Ecuador mamallaktapa unanchatami pawaychinkuna.
French(fr): Le corps central, érigé sous le gouvernement du Dr Gabriel García Moreno, abrite une horloge et ses cloches, installées sous la présidence du Dr Jerónimo Carrión entre 1865 et 1867. Le Drapeau National flotte au sommet. Ouvert du lundi au vendredi de 7h00 à 17h00 et les samedis, dimanches et jours fériés de 8h à 17h.
English(en): The central body, built during the administration of Dr. Gabriel García Moreno, houses a clock and its bells, which were installed during the presidency of Dr. Jerónimo Carrión between 1865 and 1867. The national flag flies at the top, open Monday through Friday from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. and Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.

English(en): The transformative apparatus proposed by Liberalism can be understood through the analysis of everyday political actions recorded in the Presidential Decree books.

French(fr): La constitution rédigée par l'Assemblée nationale constituante reconnaît que « l'Équateur est un État constitutionnel de droits et de justice, social, démocratique, souverain, indépendant, unitaire, interculturel, plurinational et laïque » (art. 1).
English(en): The constitution drafted by the National Constituent Assembly states that "Ecuador is a constitutional State of rights and justice, social, democratic, sovereign, independent, unitary, intercultural, plurinational, and secular" (Art. 1).
